intro: Epilobium constrictum, commonly known as narrowleaf willow herb, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows and stream banks. The plant features slender, ascending stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy flowers are typically pink or purple, with four petals and numerous stamens, making it visually striking. Epilobium constrictum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
